definitions.definition: To haul or drag along (especially something heavy); to carry ; to pull .
examples: Why do you always lug around so many books?

definitions.definition: To run at too slow a speed .
examples: When driving up a hill, choose a lower gear so you don't lug the engine.

definitions.definition: To carry an excessive amount of sail for the conditions prevailing .
To pull toward the inside rail ("lugging in") or the outside rail ("lugging out") during a race.

main_definition: ( transitive , sometimes figurative ) To haul or drag along (especially something heavy); to carry ; to pull .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To run at too slow a speed .
( transitive , nautical ) To carry an excessive amount of sail for the conditions prevailing .
( intransitive , horse-racing ) To pull toward the inside rail ("lugging in") or the outside rail ("lugging out") during a race.
